Profile.name: Teemu Tupola
Profile.title: Backend/Web Developer
Profile.description: I am a software developer from Hämeenlinna, Finland, always curious and not afraid to ask questions! I am a third-year Business Information Technology student at HAMK with solid programming skills and a strong focus on developing reliable and functional software solutions. I am especially interested in backend and web development, bug-fixing and debugging, as they allow me to use my problem-solving skills and curiosity in the best possible way.
Profile.quote: "I learn best by doing – with a little touch of humour."

Projects.Spoiler: *Click a project to see more details.

projects.title: Thesis: Automating the customer support process with agenttic automation
projects.description: In spring 2026, I am working on my thesis titled "Automating the customer support process with agent-based automation, Comparison of automation platforms and Proof of Concept implementation." The client for the thesis is Triplan Oy. In the thesis, I compare automation platforms and develop a Proof of Concept solution that explores the use of agent-based automation to improve customer support processes. More information about the project will be provided later.

projects.title: Finna integration PoC for Triplan Oy
projects.description: I was part of a team that developed a prototype OAI-PMH provider for Triplan Oy to enable integration with Finna. My primary responsibility in the project was implementing the Triplan REST API integration, focusing on building authenticated API calls, retrieving and normalizing data. The REST integration layer shown in the diagram is a key component in ensuring system reliability and accurate data delivery to Finna.
projects.Feedback: My experience acting as Product Owner for this HAMK team was excellent. They were professional, communicative, and took real responsibility for the project. The team didn't settle for the easy path. They proactively chose to learn our specific tech stack (Java Spring) to ensure a frictionless handover and adoption on our end. The quality of their resulting solution was impressive. They clearly exceeded my expectations, and I highly recommend them for future collaborations. - Joni Turunen, CTO Triplan Oy

projects.title: Personal Portfolio 3.0
projects.description: The third and newest version of my personal portfolio. The different versions demonstrate my development over time, how I have learned new technologies and improved my implementation methods. The website showcases my skills, projectsand knowledge gained during my studies. Built with Next.js and styled to be responsive and clean.

media.alt: Screenshot of portfolio website in development
Screenshot of portfolio website in development

projects.title: React Native Application
projects.description: A school project where we created a React Native mobile application as a continuation of a movie review website. The app uses REST API endpoints implemented in the backend project to fetch movies and display them in a clear mobile user interface. Users can browse movies, view detailed informationand read reviews written by others.

projects.title: Movie Review Website
projects.description: A school project completed as the final assignment for the Backend course in spring 2025. We developed a movie review website using React, where the site retrieves movies from TheMovieDB API and stores them in a MongoDB database, from which they are fetched into the UI. Users can freely browse movies and after logging in, also review them. The project was extended in the Mobile Programming course by building a React Native mobile version of the application, providing the same functionality as the web app but with a user interface optimized for mobile use

projects.title: AI-based Invoice Assistant
projects.description: In Burgos, Spain i participated in the RUN-EU BIP Smart Everything course, where international teams developed AI-based solutions for real business problems. Our project focused on invoice processing using artificial intelligence (AI Invoice Assistant / Finsum AI). The course included an intensive week in Burgos and a 4 week remote working phase. During the project, I was responsible for the user interface and integrating the large language model. The project used various frameworks and technologies, such as Python, Hugging Face, Streamlit and Astro.

media.alt: Image of the my team in Burgos

projects.title: Automation Robotics
projects.description: A school project where we implemented an invoice processing workflow using robotic process automation. The solution utilized UiPath, Robot Framework and Python to automate reading PDF invoices, extracting data, storing it and performing validations. UiPath read all PDF invoices, parsed header and line-item detailsand saved them into CSV files. Robot Framework transferred the data into a database using SQL queries and updated the processing status of invoices. Python and Robot Framework were also used for various validations, such as checking reference numbers, IBAN codes and invoice totals.

projects.title: Software Testing
projects.description: Course final project where we practiced designing and implementing software testing using Robot Framework. During the project, we created automated tests for a website, focusing on validating UI functionality and key user flows. The work included defining test cases, building test scenarios, leveraging keyword-driven test automation, as well as executing the tests and analyzing the results.

projects.title: LejosEV3
projects.description: A school project where we programmed a Lejos EV3 Lego robot to follow a color-marked path on the floor and detect and avoid obstacles using sensors. In addition to robot programming, we implemented remote control functionality by creating a REST API that allowed the robot to be controlled through a web browser, enabling usage without physical interaction.

LifeCareer.Info: I am a 22-year-old developer from Hämeenlinna and my interest in technology has been with me since middle school. I have always wanted to understand how things work and that same curiosity eventually led me to software development. I graduated from vocational school as an ICT support technician. I completed my military service mainly in Parola and specialized in reconnaissance drones. Serving as a drone operator made the experience extremely interesting. I have since been building my skills toward a career as a software developer. I enjoy traveling and seeing new places whenever I get the opportunity. These experiences have broadened my perspective and strengthened my willingness to take on new challenges. I believe they have helped shape me into a relaxed, approachable and collaborative person who enjoys working with others and learning from them. I’m currently in my final year of studies and excited to see where my path as a developer will lead next. My goal is to grow into a professional, who creates clear and functional solutions while keeping just the right touch of humor in the process.

Abilities.Info: My strengths include problem-solving, teamwork and a strong desire to continuously learn. I perform best in a team where I can share ideas, learn from others and build solutions collaboratively. I have worked in various types of projects and situations, which has improved my adaptability and flexibility in work environments.

Goals.Info: My goal is to grow as a software developer and learn something new in every project. I want to strengthen my backend and web development skills and gain a deeper understanding of software architecture, databases and cloud environments. I aim to think more holistically, recognize real client needs and build solutions that help both users and developers. I see my career as a long-term learning journey towards becoming a senior developer. I want to take responsibility, be a valuable teammate, improve my communication skills and face new challenges with confidence. I am motivated by building something meaningful, functional and impactful.

Freetime.Info: In my free time, I enjoy doing much more than just sitting at a computer. Working outdoors in fields and forests and using a chainsaw have surprisingly become meaningful hobbies for me — they allow hands-on work and connection with nature. I also love spending time with friends, whether it's being outside, gaming, or simply chatting.

Pic.alt: Me in a tractor in the field

Harrastukset.title: Running

Harrastukset.title: Programming
Harrastukset.Koodaus: Programming is both a hobby and a passion for me. I enjoy learning new languages and technologies and building meaningful projects.

Harrastukset.title: Gaming
